result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel M Montemayor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.
Consecutive to: 14CF817

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

No Contact with co-actor. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain employment and/or school combination. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours, commencing forthwith. Release for standard conditions. Release for Child Care is authorized by the court as long as agent deems appropriate.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel M Montemayor in court, in custody, with Attorney Steven R. Kohn.   Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State makes sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Kohn makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #2:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

 42 MONTHS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - _ days)    **Consecutive to 14CF817**
  -  18 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  24 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: Co-actor
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  6 MONTHS,  Non-working hours with standard release conditions (child care is authorized by the court as long as agent deems appropriate) 

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Sentencing hearing on February 5, 2015 at 02:15 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Daniel M Montemayor in court with Attorney Steven R. Kohn.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #2.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #2.  Count #3 is dismissed and read-in.  Attorney Kohn requests a presentence investigation.  Court orders a presentence investigation and sets a date for sentencing.   Court revokes bail.  Defendant to be held in custody until sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 02:15 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 5, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Daniel M Montemayor in court, in custody, with Attorney Steven R. Kohn.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kohn requests a plea and sentence date.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 5, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Daniel M Montemayor in court, in custody, with attorney Steven R. Kohn.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for November 14, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Prior: 3414 S 13th St, Milwaukee, WI 53215
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant Daniel M Montemayor in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has not spoken to the Public Defender's Office.   Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant advised court that Attorney Steven Kohn represents him on another pending case and he will retain him on this case.  Preliminary  Hearing time limits tolled. Court authorizes a non collect call to contact his parents and/or his attorney.  Hearing scheduled for October 3, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
